contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the phrases "the shepherd" and "the lion" refer to any shepherd or lion. Alternate translation: "As a shepherd ... a lion" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-genericnoun]])

Some of the wealthy people had two houses: one that they lived in during the winter and one that they lived in during the summer. This refers to any winter and summer houses. Alternate translation: "the houses they live in during the winter and the houses they live in during the summer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-genericnoun]])
contextId.glQuote: the winter house with the summer house

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to any piece of land where it did not rain. Alternate translation: "the pieces of land where it did not rain" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-genericnoun]])
contextId.glQuote: the piece of land where it did not rain

contextId.occurrenceNote: These phrases refer to any cities that sent out large numbers of soldiers. Alternate translation: "Cities that went out with a thousand ... cities that went out with a hundred" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-genericnoun]])
contextId.glQuote: The city that went out with a thousand ... the one that went out with a hundred
